[http://code.google.com/p/imsdroid/ IMSDroid] is a free software licensed under the GNU GPLv3 license terms. As far as the commercial product based on IMSDroid or [http://doubango.org doubango] isn't a closed-source software, there is no license violation. However, if your commercial product is a closed-source software and you want to keep it closed, then you should get a non-GPL license. <br />
We provided a non-GPL version of all components used in both [http://code.google.com/p/imsdroid/ IMSDroid] and [http://doubango.org doubango] except for [http://www.videolan.org/developers/x264.html x264]. <br />
